channel.title: Communities
channel.description:
I recently joined a few servers since I haven't been playing any much and wanted to see how they were progressing thus far. What I found actually made me quite mad. You see, I find that most of the communities out there are absolute shit today.
What I mean is that, I'll log onto a server and get a nice welcoming from some members, both new and old, and I'll begin my normal routine of training. However, a few days into playing, I notice that everyone besides the maybe 3 people who welcomed me are quite immature, including the staff. I actually got banned on one due to disagreeing with the mod's views on war.
What I'm getting at is, does the immaturity of a community drive you away, or are you willing to deal with it long enough to play?

item.title: Communities
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“JavaTC, post:15, topic:484823”][quote author=Elrick link=topic=603057.msg4226723#msg4226723 date=1361037342]

Moparscape isn’t as bad, we do joke around, a lot, but we aren’t like “lol nub ur such a fag”… with every post.

Apparently you haven’t been in many of rule’s posting on threads lately :P.

OT: I agree that it is hard to see how reliable a player being a moderator is, but there are early warning signs. ESPECIALLY their ability to spell. I have seen some self proclaimed “28 year olds” who’s English was so broken I found myself correcting loads of mistakes on every official thread they posted. How they communicate with the playerbase is incredibly important and it should be. If owners pay attention to what the community says then they should have no problem seeing what their mods are like.

Also, remember that owners are going to place staff members who are like them in personality, which unfortunately isn’t always for the better.
[/quote]
I actually see this on many chat sites now, many of the people that are 22 & 23 still using “how ru” and “ur”, it’s quite annoying considering I’m 17 and type anywhere from 40-60 wpm with pretty decent grammar and spelling.

This is what you should always expect when playing private servers, even if the feedback seems good from most existing players. Communities are usually corrupted because staff members don’t regulate the rules and enforce them how they should, either because they don’t expect a paycheck or aren’t monitored by some higher power. There was a confessions thread on the NR forums, which consisted of many things that staff members admitted to doing, which were absolutely horrible things when considered by some type of professionally set standard.

In other words, people will most likely be corrupted if they feel as if they can do whatever they want without being punished or having other consequences.

I also see this quite a bit. I’d rather they choose staff that can be somewhat professional without trying than choosing a little kid who’s professional but rather inconsistent with his word.[/quote]
The sad thing is that someone can come close to being professional, only expectation-wise; a true professional is paid to complete a certain task, while also having a set of guidelines stating what they can and cannot do. If people know they can get away for something only to have some type of beneficial gain for themselves, why not do it?

Read full topic

It’s a sad but common thing. Immaturity on RSPS has always been there, and sadly, always will.

item.title: Communities
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“runescape sucks, post:7, topic:484823”]Someone mentioned something about the maturity of staff, and I have to say, that’s hard to come by. It’s pretty easy to deceive somebody and make them believe that you’re trustworthy, and mature.

I’ve been fooled countless times, and when I finally did find out that they were not as mature that I expected, they have already banned half the server or something similar.[/quote]
Very true. I remember applying for staff on one server and I got rejected over a 14 year old who still can’t tell the difference between there and their. He was quite immature compared to the way I act.

I’m also not saying I’m #1 staff for every server but I’m a hell of allot better than anyone else that applied on that specific server, but because the other could get on 2 hours more he got accepted.

Read full topic

item.title: Communities
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

Someone mentioned something about the maturity of staff, and I have to say, that’s hard to come by. It’s pretty easy to deceive somebody and make them believe that you’re trustworthy, and mature.

I’ve been fooled countless times, and when I finally did find out that they were not as mature that I expected, they have already banned half the server or something similar.

item.title: Communities
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

If you were on my server, all bans are reviewed by me personally. Conflicts or not, a owner, mod, admin, or any sort of staff should not ban because they don’t like the person. It must be a legitimate reason, or they do not deserve to be staff.

Read full topic

item.title: Communities
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

I believe if the server/client developers are mature, they will pick mature enough staff that will not abuse their powers and do ridiculous stuff because they’re insecure with themselves. Although, you can’t be too picky with the players because the age ranges could be vast from around 8 to 30, maybe even older. Like me, I’m mature and serious when it comes to programming/managing a server, but if you met me in real life, you’d probably want to wish you never met me or want to cut your ears off. I am a big ass troll/smart ass in real life.

Read full topic

item.title: Communities
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

This is most unfortunate with 2006 remakes. When I started playing this specific type I had anticipated that players rejoining this era of RS would attempt to emulate the old community as much as possible. It’s a 2013 community in a 2006 remake. If you have censorship, the kids freak out and scream for its removal, or they just find ways to move around it.

Honestly every server needs a public relations position, where it is their job to make sure the server is maintained in a fashion in which the owner has described.

Read full topic

item.title: Communities
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

It really does, whenever I join some servers, and I ask them a basic question(Like how to get somewhere) they’re like “roflmao u dont kno how to get thr? nub”

Read full topic
